Sentencas: Solid oxide fuel cells are extremely flexible energy conversion systems able to operate within a broad temperature range (500-1000 degrees C), with a variety of fuels (from hydrogen to liquid fuels), including concepts able to be scaled to deliver power from the milliwatt to the megawatt range.
Titulo: Electrolytes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The solid electrolyte, as an ionic charge carrier, is one central component that determines the operational characteristics of the fuel cell system, namely the working temperature.
Titulo: Electrolytes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Design of new electrolytes includes manipulation of ionic defects concentration and mobility.
Titulo: Electrolytes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Here, particular attention is given to the impact on ionic transport of point defects in various types of structures, dislocations, grain boundaries, and heterostructure interfaces.
Titulo: Electrolytes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Properties derived from structural and compositional characteristics, but also from microstructural features, including recent complex engineered thin films, are reviewed.
Titulo: Electrolytes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Major families of materials are compared with respect to key performance parameters.
Titulo: Electrolytes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Finally, the effects of composition, structure, microstructure, and strain on ionic transport are assessed as complementary tools for future developments in solid electrolyte materials.
Titulo: Electrolytes for solid oxide fuel cells
